meanings.definition: A unit of energy equal to the work done by a force of one newton acting through a distance of one meter.
meanings.sent1: She measured the energy in joules used to lift the box.
meanings.sent2: The light bulb consumed 60 joules of energy in an hour.
meanings.sent3: The joules in the battery were ready to power the toy car.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm radiated like a burst of joules in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays delivered warmth in joules to the plants.

meanings.definition: The SI unit of work or energy, equal to the work done by a force of one newton when its point of application moves one meter in the direction of action of the force.
meanings.sent1: The scientist calculated the joules of energy required to move the object.
meanings.sent2: It took 10 joules of energy to push the heavy door open.
meanings.sent3: The joules in the battery were on strike, refusing to power the device.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a source of endless joules during the marathon.
meanings.sent5: The storm unleashed joules of power, causing the lights to flicker.
